17static pthread_mutex_t malloc_disabled_lock = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
18static bool malloc_disabled_tcache;
19
20static void je_iterate_chunk(arena_chunk_t *chunk,
21 void (*callback)(uintptr_t ptr, size_t size, void* arg), void* arg);
22static void je_iterate_small(arena_run_t *run,
23 void (*callback)(uintptr_t ptr, size_t size, void* arg), void* arg);
24
25/* je_iterate calls callback for each allocation found in the memory region
26 * between [base, base+size). base will be rounded down to by the jemalloc
27 * chunk size, and base+size will be rounded up to the chunk size. If no memory
28 * managed by jemalloc is found in the requested region, je_iterate returns -1
29 * and sets errno to EINVAL.
30 *
31 * je_iterate must be called when no allocations are in progress, either
32 * when single-threaded (for example just after a fork), or between
33 * jemalloc_prefork() and jemalloc_postfork_parent(). The callback must
34 * not attempt to allocate with jemalloc.
35 */
36int je_iterate(uintptr_t base, size_t size,
37 void (*callback)(uintptr_t ptr, size_t size, void* arg), void* arg) {
38
39 int error = EINVAL;
40 uintptr_t ptr = (uintptr_t)CHUNK_ADDR2BASE(base);
41 uintptr_t end = CHUNK_CEILING(base + size);
42
43 while (ptr < end) {
44 extent_node_t *node;
45
46 node = chunk_lookup((void *)ptr, false);
47 if (node == NULL) {
48 ptr += chunksize;
49 continue;
50 }
51
52 assert(extent_node_achunk_get(node) ||
53 (uintptr_t)extent_node_addr_get(node) == ptr);
54
55 error = 0;
56 if (extent_node_achunk_get(node)) {
57 /* Chunk */
58 arena_chunk_t *chunk = (arena_chunk_t *)ptr;
59 ptr += chunksize;
60
61 if (&chunk->node != node) {
62 /* Empty retained chunk */
63 continue;
64 }
65
66 je_iterate_chunk(chunk, callback, arg);
67 } else if ((uintptr_t)extent_node_addr_get(node) == ptr) {
68 /* Huge allocation */
69 callback(ptr, extent_node_size_get(node), arg);
70 ptr += extent_node_size_get(node);
71 }
72 }
73
74 if (error) {
75 set_errno(error);
76 return -1;
77 }
78
79 return 0;
80}
81
82/* Iterate over a valid jemalloc chunk, calling callback for each large
83 * allocation run, and calling je_iterate_small for each small allocation run */
84static void je_iterate_chunk(arena_chunk_t *chunk,
85 void (*callback)(uintptr_t ptr, size_t size, void* arg), void* arg) {
86 size_t pageind;
87
88 pageind = map_bias;
89
90 while (pageind < chunk_npages) {
91 size_t mapbits;
92 size_t size;
93
94 mapbits = arena_mapbits_get(chunk, pageind);
95 if (!arena_mapbits_allocated_get(chunk, pageind)) {
96 /* Unallocated run */
97 size = arena_mapbits_unallocated_size_get(chunk, pageind);
98 } else if (arena_mapbits_large_get(chunk, pageind)) {
99 /* Large allocation run */
100 void *rpages;
101
102 size = arena_mapbits_large_size_get(chunk, pageind);
103 rpages = arena_miscelm_to_rpages(arena_miscelm_get(chunk, pageind));
104 callback((uintptr_t)rpages, size, arg);
105 } else {
106 /* Run of small allocations */
107 szind_t binind;
108 arena_run_t *run;
109
110 assert(arena_mapbits_small_runind_get(chunk, pageind) == pageind);
111 binind = arena_mapbits_binind_get(chunk, pageind);
112 run = &arena_miscelm_get(chunk, pageind)->run;
113 assert(run->binind == binind);
114 size = arena_bin_info[binind].run_size;
115
116 je_iterate_small(run, callback, arg);
117 }
118 assert(size == PAGE_CEILING(size));
119 assert(size > 0);
120 pageind += size >> LG_PAGE;
121 }
122
123}
124
125/* Iterate over a valid jemalloc small allocation run, calling callback for each
126 * active allocation. */
127static void je_iterate_small(arena_run_t *run,
128 void (*callback)(uintptr_t ptr, size_t size, void* arg), void* arg) {
129 szind_t binind;
130 const arena_bin_info_t *bin_info;
131 uint32_t regind;
132 uintptr_t ptr;
133 void *rpages;
134
135 binind = run->binind;
136 bin_info = &arena_bin_info[binind];
137 rpages = arena_miscelm_to_rpages(arena_run_to_miscelm(run));
138 ptr = (uintptr_t)rpages + bin_info->reg0_offset;
139
140 for (regind = 0; regind < bin_info->nregs; regind++) {
141 if (bitmap_get(run->bitmap, &bin_info->bitmap_info, regind)) {
142 callback(ptr, bin_info->reg_size, arg);
143 }
144 ptr += bin_info->reg_interval;
145 }
146}
147
148static void je_malloc_disable_prefork() {
149 pthread_mutex_lock(&malloc_disabled_lock);
150}
151
152static void je_malloc_disable_postfork_parent() {
153 pthread_mutex_unlock(&malloc_disabled_lock);
154}
155
156static void je_malloc_disable_postfork_child() {
157 pthread_mutex_init(&malloc_disabled_lock, NULL);
158}
159
160void je_malloc_disable_init() {
161 if (pthread_atfork(je_malloc_disable_prefork,
162 je_malloc_disable_postfork_parent, je_malloc_disable_postfork_child) != 0) {
163 malloc_write("<jemalloc>: Error in pthread_atfork()\n");
164 if (opt_abort)
165 abort();
166 }
167}
168
169void je_malloc_disable() {
170 static pthread_once_t once_control = PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT;
171 pthread_once(&once_control, je_malloc_disable_init);
172
173 pthread_mutex_lock(&malloc_disabled_lock);
174 bool new_tcache = false;
175 size_t old_len = sizeof(malloc_disabled_tcache);
176 je_mallctl("thread.tcache.enabled",
177 &malloc_disabled_tcache, &old_len,
178 &new_tcache, sizeof(new_tcache));
179 jemalloc_prefork();
180}
181
182void je_malloc_enable() {
183 jemalloc_postfork_parent();
184 if (malloc_disabled_tcache) {
185 je_mallctl("thread.tcache.enabled", NULL, NULL,
186 &malloc_disabled_tcache, sizeof(malloc_disabled_tcache));
187 }
188 pthread_mutex_unlock(&malloc_disabled_lock);
189}
